sen.j: 西園寺賞季（さいおんじ よしすえ、寛保3年8月12日 (旧暦)（1743年9月29日） - 寛政11年12月22日 (旧暦)（1800年1月16日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Yoshisue SAIONJI (September 29, 1743 to January 16, 1800) was a court noble in the middle of Edo period.
Yoshisue SAIONJI (September 29, 1743 to January 16, 1800) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle Edo period.
sen.cmt: Kugyoを追加し、court nobleを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Yoshisue SAIONJI (September 29, 1743 to January 16, 1800) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle Edo period.

sen.j: 桃園天皇（116代）・後桜町天皇（117代）・後桃園天皇（118代）・光格天皇（119代）の四帝にわたり仕え、官位は従一位右大臣まで昇る。
sen.e: He served for four emperors: Emperor Momozono (the 116th), Emperor Gosakuramachi (the 117th), Emperor Gomomozono (the 118th), and Emperor Kokaku (the 119th), and he rose to Juichii-udaijin (minister of the right at the Junior First Rank).

He served for the four sovereigns: the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi, the 118th Emperor Gomomozono and the 119th Emperor Kokaku, and he was promoted up to Juichii-Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: four emperors→the four emperorsを訂正しました。天皇の何代の位置を移動しました。役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。rose to →promoted up toに訂正しました。minister of the right at the Junior First Rank→Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right 他のファイルとの表現を統一するため訂正しました。
sen.e: He served for the four sovereigns: the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi, the 118th Emperor Gomomozono and the 119th Emperor Kokaku, and he was promoted up to Juichii-Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right).

sen.j: 父に内大臣西園寺公晃。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (minister of the center) Kinaki SAIONJI.
His father was Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Kinaki SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Kinaki SAIONJI.

sen.j: 母は内大臣今出川伊季の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Naidaijin Koresue IMADEGAWA.
His mother was a daughter of Naidaijin Koresue IMADEGAWA.
His mother was a daughter of Naidaijin Koresue IMADEGAWA.

sen.j: 妻は広幡長忠の娘（近衛内前の猶子）。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Nagatada HIROHATA (an adopted child of Uchisaki KONOE).
His wife was a daughter of Nagatada HIROHATA, who was adopted by Uchisaki KONOE.
sen.cmt: adopted childの部分の表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Nagatada HIROHATA, who was adopted by Uchisaki KONOE.

sen.j: 実子に従五位西園寺公兼、近衛府西園寺公氏、中納言野宮定業の室、長州藩主毛利匡芳の室がいる。
sen.e: His biological son was Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) Kinkane SAIONJI, Kinuji SAIONJI who was at Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), a lawful wife of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Sadanari NONOMIYA, a lawful wife of the lord of the Choshu clan, Masayoshi MORI.

He had several biological children including Kinkane SAIONJI in the title Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank), Kinuji SAIONJI who was in Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), a daughter who was a legitimate wife of Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) Sadanari NONOMIYA and another daughter who was a legitimate wife of the lord of the Choshu clan, Masayoshi MORI.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスです。全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: He had several biological children including Kinkane SAIONJI in the title Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank), Kinuji SAIONJI who was in Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), a daughter who was a legitimate wife of Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) Sadanari NONOMIYA and another daughter who was a legitimate wife of the lord of the Choshu clan, Masayoshi MORI.

sen.j: 養子縁組に近衛府西園寺実韶（一条輝良の子）、権中納言西園寺寛季（二条治孝の子）がいる。
sen.e: He adopted Sanetsugu SAIONJI who was at Konoefu (a son of Teruyoshi ICHIJO), and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) Hirosue SAIONJI (a son of Harutaka NIJO).

He had some adopted sons including Sanetsugu SAIONJI in Konoefu who was a biological son of Teruyoshi ICHIJO and Hirosue SAIONJI of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) who was a biological son of Harutaka NIJO.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスです。全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: He had some adopted sons including Sanetsugu SAIONJI in Konoefu who was a biological son of Teruyoshi ICHIJO and Hirosue SAIONJI of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) who was a biological son of Harutaka NIJO.
In 1748, he was conferred a peerage.
In 1748, he was conferred a peerage.
In 1748, he was conferred a peerage.

sen.j: 以降清華家当主として速いスピードで累進して、宝暦6年（1756年）に従三位に達して公卿に列した。
sen.e: Since then he got promoted quickly as the head of the Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families in Japan at that time), and in 1756, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and he was raised to the court noble.

Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1756, he achieved to become Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性をとるため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1756, he achieved to become Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: その後、中納言・大納言を経て、明和元年（1764年）には大歌所別当や踏歌節会外弁に補された。
sen.e: He served as Chunagon and Dainagon (chief councilor of state), then he was appointed as the chief officer of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office) and Toka no sechie Geben [a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)].

After he served as Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) and Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State), he was appointed the positions of the chief officer of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office) and "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]).
sen.cmt: Chunagonの定訳を追加しました。asを削除、afterを追加しました。カッコを訂正しました。役職に""を追加しました。
sen.e: After he served as Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) and Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State), he was appointed the positions of the chief officer of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office) and "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]).

sen.j: 明和5年（1768年）には皇太子英仁親王（のちの後桃園天皇）の春宮坊となるも、明和7年（1770年）の親王の践祚とともに辞す。
sen.e: In 1768, he became Togubo (Crown Prince's Quarters) for Imperial Prince Hidehito (later Emperor Gomomozono), but resigned as the accession of the prince in 1770.
In 1768, he became Togubo (Crown Prince's Quarters) for Imperial Prince Hidehito (later the Emperor Gomomozono); He resigned the position when the prince ascended the throne of Emperor in 1770.
sen.cmt: butを削除しました。resigned as the accession of the prince→esigned the position when the prince ascended the throne of Emperorに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1768, he became Togubo (Crown Prince's Quarters) for Imperial Prince Hidehito (later the Emperor Gomomozono); He resigned the position when the prince ascended the throne of Emperor in 1770.

sen.j: 安永4年（1775年）内大臣に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1775, he was appointed as Naidaijin.
In 1775, he was appointed Naidaijin.
In 1775, he was appointed Naidaijin.

sen.j: 寛政2年（1790年）従一位に叙される。
sen.e: In 1790, he was conferred as Juichii.
In 1790, he was given the title Juichii.
sen.cmt: was confered as→was given the titleに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1790, he was given the title Juichii.

sen.j: 寛政8年（1796年）に右大臣に任じられるも辞した。
sen.e: In 1796, he was appointed as Udaijin (minister of the right), but declined.
In 1796, although he was appointed Udaijin (Minister of the Right), he declined to take the position.
sen.cmt: asを削除しました。although, to take the positionを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1796, although he was appointed Udaijin (Minister of the Right), he declined to take the position.

sen.j: 男子には実子の公兼、公氏と養子の実韶の三人がいたが、相次いで先立たれている。
sen.e: He had three sons: Kinkane and Kinuji who were biological sons, and Sanetsugu who was adopted, but they passed away one after another.
He had three sons; two biological sons were Kinkane and Kinuji, and one adopted son was Sanetsugu; Unfortunately, they successively passed away before he died.
sen.cmt: 訳抜けです。Before he diedを追加しました。Who was adopted→whom he adoptedに訂正しました。Unfortunatelyを追加しました。one after another→successively訂正しました。
sen.e: He had three sons; two biological sons were Kinkane and Kinuji, and one adopted son was Sanetsugu; Unfortunately, they successively passed away before he died.

sen.j: 西園寺家の相続人がいなくなったために、左大臣二条治孝の三男の寛季を養子に迎えて西園寺家を相続させた。
sen.e: As he had no heirs left, he adopted Hirosue, the third son of Sadaijin Harutaka NIJO, and had him inherit the Saionji family.
Because there was no eligible successor in the Saionji family, he adopted Hirosue who was the third son of Sadaijin Harutaka NIJO; Consequently, Hirosue became heir to the Saionji Family.
sen.cmt: 文法を整理し、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Because there was no eligible successor in the Saionji family, he adopted Hirosue who was the third son of Sadaijin Harutaka NIJO; Consequently, Hirosue became heir to the Saionji Family.
